New Records: It was Cleveland’s first appearance in the ALCS since 2016.
It was the 10th winner-take-all game in franchise history and their first victory in such a game since beating the Yankees in Game 5 of the 1997 ALDS.
Lane Thomas' grand slam was the first postseason grand slam by a Cleveland player since Francisco Lindor in Game 2 of the ALDS in 2017.
Steven Kwan tied Kenny Lofton for the longest postseason hitting streak in Cleveland history with 10 games.
Steven Kwan is just the third player in history to have three consecutive three-hit postseason games, joining Tim Anderson and Hall of Famer Lou Brock.
Cade Smith's 12 strikeouts in 6 1/3 innings are the most in a league division series.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam in the fifth inning.
Steven Kwan had another three-hit game.
Emmanuel Clase secured a two-inning save.
Andres Gimenez hit a leadoff single to start the fifth inning rally.
Jose Ramirez was hit by a pitch to bring in a run and tie the score.
Jake Rogers and Colt Keith added RBI hits for the Tigers.
Brayan Rocchio scored a run in the eighth inning.
Eli Morgan stopped a Tigers rally with consecutive strikeouts.
Matthew Boyd struck out five batters in two innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Stephen Vogt believed the Guardians would advance to the ALCS and board a flight to New York.
Vogt emphasized the importance of belief in the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Vogt expressed pride in the team's resilience and belief.
Vogt praised the Tigers and acknowledged the competitive nature of the series.
Vogt highlighted Lane Thomas' grand slam as a pivotal moment.
The Guardians will face the Yankees in Game 1 of the ALCS.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians and Tigers played each other 18 times this year, with the Guardians winning 10 of those games.
The Guardians hit .234 with 19 runs and four homers in the ALDS, while the Tigers hit .214 with 13 runs and two homers.
The Tigers had a chance to eliminate the Guardians in Game 4, but the Guardians rallied for a 5-4 win to send the series back to Cleveland.
